ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Overall an extremely fulfilling course. Introduced us to the globalization debates and very interesting and relevant theoretical material and then case studies. Class was always interesting and Kamari led the course very well. The workload was perfectly manageable and I learned a lot from the weekly reading responses and final paper. I would definitely recommend this course.
Useful background for people interested in anthropological analysis and also interdisciplinary work. The issues brought up in the course were challenging but useful.
Yes, I would strongly recommend the course to another student.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I am very interested in writing a transnational ethnographic dissertation and so these readings will be useful. Some of them will also be useful for an orals field in ethnography.
